intro: Veronica fuhsii, commonly known as the Fuhs' speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as meadows and cliffs. It produces small, elliptical leaves and has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
